disobey.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to refuse to do what someone with authority tells you to do, or refuse to obey a rule or law
disobey.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: disobey
to not obey a person, order, rule, or law
In the army, it is a crime to disobey a superior officer.
He had disobeyed the school rules.
break a law/rule
to not obey a law or rule
Anyone who breaks the law must expect to be punished.
defy
to deliberately refuse to obey a rule or law, or what someone in authority tells you to do
The police arrested the youth for defying a court order.
flout
to deliberately disobey a rule or law in a very public way
Timber companies are continuing to flout environmental laws.
violate
to disobey a law, or do something that is against an agreement or principle
Both countries have accused each other of violating the treaty.
Technically he had violated the law.
contravene
to be against a law, rule, or agreement, or to do something that is against a law, rule, or agreement
The British governmentâ€™s actions contravened the European Convention on Human Rights.
